intro: Chionanthus broomeanus, commonly known as the Broom's chionathus, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, white, pendulous flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing year-round structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
